dmca.title: Patrick Harris re: cease and desist
dmca.body:
To: ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. and all subsidiaries
C/o Andrea Almeida, Associate General Council
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110, Dallas, TX 75207
Tel: 214-782-7800/e-mail: copyright@theplanet.com

From: Patrick Harris
P.O. Box 1338 Lakin, KS 67860
Tel: 404-921-1417/email:unternicht@yahoo.com

Re: Patrick James Egan, pictures and information on i.p. address 66.98.160.97 Cease and Desist. And David G. Letter from Mugshots.com

December 5, 2006
Dear Mrs. Almeida,


I am writing to you to request that you remove all images, information, representations and links to Patrick James Egan from your client, Mugshots.com at i.p. address 66.98.160.97 immediately for the following reasons;
1. The record of this individual has been expunged and information removed from the initial Sheriffs website.
2. There is a letter stating(attached to email at bottom) that such information regarding Patrick James Egan would be removed if #1 took place. It has and thus the party whom utilizes your server needs to comply with his previous promise.
3. As the record is expunged and sealed it would appear that the pictures etc of Patrick James Egan are proprietary.
4. Libel

The method for accomplishing this follows.
1.)     Currently the following URL http://www.mugshots.com/IMAGES/Mugshot__PATRICK-JAMES-EGAN.jpg still contains valid link to the image, which is why GOOGLE IMAGE is still indexing the image and making it available via searching on Google Image. 
2.)     The owner of the site (i.e. www.mugshots.com) will need to do the following:
a.       Remove the IMAGE from their server
b.       Edit their robots.txt file to DISALLOW the following image
                                                               i.      /IMAGES/Mugshot__PATRICK-JAMES-EGAN.jpg
For example:
User-agent: Googlebot-Image
Disallow: /images/Mugshot_PATRICK-JAMES-EGAN.jpg
 3.)     If the owners of www.mugshots.com will edit their robots.txt file to disallow the indexing of that particular image (as well as removing it from servers!) the next time Google Image crawls the site, your image will be removed from the index
This needs to happen for both the images and the pages.

I demand that you immediately cease the use and distribution of all infringing works derived of Patrick James Egan and all copies, including electronic copies, of same, that you deliver to me, if applicable, all unused, undistributed copies of same, or destroy such copies immediately and that you desist from this or any other infringement of my rights in the future. If I have not received an affirmative response from you by December 18, 2006 indicating that you have fully complied with these requirements, I shall take further action against you.

Sincerely,
Patrick Harris

I attest that the information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that I am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.


Date:	Thu, 9 Sep 2004 21:30:01 -0500
To:	irisherinnnnn@yahoo.com
Subject:	Re: patrick egan-florida
From:	pictures@mugshots.com
Text Attachment [ Scan and Save to Computer | Save to Yahoo! Briefcase ] 

Hi Erin,
Yes, we do get many emails like that and I understand what you are 
saying, however, it is not us that published that image for the first time. 
The picture is on the Monroe County office web site and was made public 
before we put it on our site.
If you can convince the Monroe County to take the image off their 
database we will remove the image from our site as well.
Best regards
Dave G.
Mugshots.com


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Erin Egan 
To: pictures@mugshots.com 
Sent: Thursday, September 09, 2004 10:10 PM
Subject: patrick egan-florida


Hello.  
I am writing to you to ask a small favor.  My brother is listed on your 
website, and I'm sure that you have many people ask you similar 
requests for this, but here goes.

He is pictured on your site as having been beaten by the cops, which 
yes, that did occur.  But you don't know all the circumstances behind 
that case.  And I'm not sure I am at liberty to discuss all of those with 
you.  I do work on the side of such enforcement, in a sense, so I am on 
the side of the Law, and I do not side with criminal activity.  But for 
the sake of my brother, who has made amends, and is leading a good 
life, and was even released from this event (so to speak) from even the Law 
Enforcement officials who were involved due to his apologies as this 
was a tragic event for the entire family, I beg of you to please take 
this photo off your website.  

I don't know if he realizes this is on your site, but often I search in 
my job capacity for such sites, and I would feel terrible if he knew 
this photo existed.  He was not sentenced to any prison time, you can 
check the records if you want.  And yes, the Law Enforcement Officers 
involved did accept all apologies.  

Again, I'm sure you receive letters such as these daily, from angry 
family members.  It is just so sad that anything like this happened in the 
family.  It was a terrible event, and it ruined so many lives.  Please, 
again, it would be so gracious of you to do this, and I would 
appreciate it so much.  I know we are not celebrities, but if  you could find it 
in your hearts to remove his photo, it would allow me to sleep at 
nights and try to forget about this event as it has practically ruined my 
life as well.

Please understand if I don't sign my name in case you are upset with my 
letter.  My intention was not do do so, but you do have my email 
address.

Sincerely,

a caring sister.




------------------------------------------------
